snippet: The government began an investigation into Monday’s violent crackdown, when police used tear gas and batons to disperse stone-throwing protesters who stormed Habib Bourguiba Avenue.
abstract: Tunisia’s Islamist-led government reverses a ban on protests on the capital’s central thoroughfare after an outcry over a violent police crackdown; it also begins an investigation into the crackdown.
lead_paragraph: The government began an investigation into Monday’s violent crackdown, when police used tear gas and batons to disperse stone-throwing protesters who stormed Habib Bourguiba Avenue.

headline.seo: Tunisia’s Ban on Habib Bourguiba Avenue Protests Is Reversed
headline.main: Tunisia’s Ban on Protests in Capital Is Reversed
headline.print_headline: Tunisia’s Ban On Protests In Capital Is Reversed

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
